sect2.title: Architecture
sect2.para: The Qt client is a thin client which executes XML requests via the Wolframe protocol and presents XML answers. It shows a set of forms using standard Qt widgets. It is cross-platform. Qt is currently available on http://doc.qt.digia.com/qt/index.html.

sect2.title: Artifacts
sect2.para: The qtclient renders user interface forms dynamically, this means no code generation or compilation is involved when creating user interfaces for Wolframe.

sect3.title: UI forms
sect3.para: The UI files follow the schema 'qt-ui-4.7.xsd', as documented in http://doc.qt.digia.com/qt/designer-ui-file-format.html. The UI files have the extension .ui
UI files can be generated with the Qt designer, see http://qt-project.org/doc/qt-4.8/designer-manual.html.

sect3.title: UI form translations
sect3.para: Currently using the Qt translation format, version 2.0 for form translations as described in http://doc.qt.digia.com/qt/linguist-ts-file-format.html. Those are the files with extension .ts.
The translation files can get merged and generated with the lupdate tool, then translated with the Qt linguist.
The client needs the files in compiled form as files with the extesion .qm. The lupdate tool is taking care of that.

sect3.title: Themes
sect3.para: Themes consist of a top-level UI-file (a QMainWindow). The central widget should be empty (that's where the forms are shown). The menu contains some hooks, where the qtclient will add menus.
Also a theme has translation files for the menu entries.

sect3.title: Qt stylesheets
sect3.para: A Qt stylesheet is similar to a CSS in HTML. It influences the look-and-feel of the form widgets. The format is described in http://qt-project.org/doc/qt-4.8/stylesheet-syntax.html. The files have usually the extension .qss.

sect2.title: "Programming" the interface
sect2.para:
Programming means we annotate the XML of th UI form files with some extra properties. They steer the following things:
On which events to replace the current form with a new form, e. g. clicking the Edit button should load the form called edit_item.
When and how requests to the Wolframe server should be sent and how the results should be interpreted when adding data to the widgets, e.g. executing a save item request with all the data in the text fields of the form added to the request XML.

sect3.title: Mapping XML data
sect3.para: Every widget in the Qt class hierarchy has a default way, how data is serialized into the request XML and how it is deserialized from the answer XML. For instance a QLineEdit element of the form will output its currently inputed text to the XML or set it from there:
Some elements are more complicated than that, they present the user a list of options or items to pick from, e.g. a list of cities.

sect3.para: When the form is saved, the currently selected element is written into the resulting XML:
In this case the widget can load its own domain data as a separate XML request.
Per default the name of the widget will be matched against the XML element with the same name.
Per default the root element of the XML request is the name of the form. This can be overloaded with the dynamic property rootelement.
Widgets like QTreeWidget and QTableWidget have a substructure, there the names of headers serve as name for the tags when serializing or deserializing the XML.
